conclusion: Consider power, collision, and deflection effects to determine final positions of A and B.
A is moving towards the right.
B is moving towards the right.
Infer that cars are moving at a similar speed.
Assume cars are moving in the same direction.
A and B will collide since they are moving towards each other in the same direction.
Collision will occur at the point where A and B are closest to each other.
Calculate distance between A and B by measuring distance between starting points.
Assume the distance between A and B is d.
A and B will collide at the midpoint of their distance.
Final positions of A and B will be at the midpoint of their distance, which is d/2.
A will stop at d/2 to the right of B.
B will stop at d/2 to the left of A.
Power of the cars is not a factor since they are moving at the same speed.
Deflection effect is not relevant since the cars are moving in the same direction.
Collision will occur at the midpoint of their distance, a common scenario in physics.
Final positions where A and B will stop are at d/2 to the right of B and d/2 to the left of A.
